verses.roman:
acirād eva sarvārthaḥ
sidhyaty eṣām abhīpsitaḥ
sad-dharmasyāvabodhāya
yeṣāṁ nirbandhinī matiḥ

synonyms: acirāt—very soon; eva—certainly; sarva-arthaḥ—the goal of life; sidhyati—becomes fulfilled; eṣām—of these persons; abhīpsitaḥ—desired; sat-dharmasya—of the path of progressive devotional service; avabodhāya—for understanding; yeṣām—those whose; nirbandhinī—unflinching; matiḥ—intelligence.
translation: " 'Those who are anxious to awaken their spiritual consciousness, who have unflinching intelligence and who are not deviated, certainly attain the desired goal.'

purport.content: This verse, quoted from the Nāradīya Purāṇa, is found in the Bhakti-rasāmṛta-sindhu (1.2.103).
